channel.title: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?
channel.description:
I am reworking the check virtualizer test of whonixcheck. Will port from virt-what to systemd-detect-virt which produces better, simpler single lined results.
Wondering what to do if it detects qemu? When virtualizer qemu is detected -> stop whonixcheck, show big unsupported error?
Related: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/QEMU

item.title: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Implemented it only as a general message. “If qemu -> recommend kvm” would require more work. Patches welcome.

https://github.com/Whonix/whonixcheck/blob/master/usr/lib/whonixcheck/check_virtualizer

Read full topic
item.source: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?

item.title: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Yes and it should recommend users move to KVM.

Read full topic
item.source: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?

item.title: Development: What should whonixcheck do if virtualizer qemu is detected?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I am reworking the check virtualizer test of whonixcheck. Will port from virt-what to systemd-detect-virt which produces better, simpler single lined results.

Wondering what to do if it detects qemu? When virtualizer qemu is detected -> stop whonixcheck, show big unsupported error?
